Message.Msg: I bought back 500 shares of DELL under 9.40 yesterday hoping that the next earnings will be better than the consensus...Despite your bullish view of DELL I see many many hurdles so. Look at the chart for God sake!!! it is a CATASTROPHE! What kind of rosy glasses are you wearing? I do not see a huge downside right now so but it is almost certain that $8's will be coming at one point? I may add then another 500 shares at 8.75? and HOLD. Dividend are not bad in the mean time....It is possible to see $11 if earnings are not disappointing but the problem is not really the earnings themselves but the financial forecast and revenue for Q4 and 2013 that will show the way up or down for pps. risky risky Good luck

Michael Dell's beach house in Anguilla cost more to build than Michele and Barry's rental on Pennsylvania ave. He could use the sale proceeds to buy back Dell stock and prop up the price...Nah, ain't gonna happen. Dell is going to He11 in a bucket.

Message.Title: Dell dying the death of 1000 cuts
Message.Msg: General Tso of the Hunan province made this torture popular during the Chinese civil war, around the same time we were fighting ours over here. The rumor is that General Tso's chicken comes out red and gooey, because that is what his victims looked like when he got done with them. Poor Dell bagholders. Sorry for your loss (s).

Message.Title: The shorts strategy is to drive the price down by issuing bogus PC death reports....
Message.Msg: So all the negative commentary is to scare the buyers and the sellers of "potential" death of the PCs while none of them has offered any numerical analysis and as I wrote yesterday, in DELL's case, our PC sales were down by 6.25%, either because they were postponed for buying Windows 8 in Q4/2012 or some consumers bought Tablets instead.... October 25th will deal with all this nonsense. This is total liars game.
